author: Michael Larabel
description: The GNU C Library's malloc implementation is now enabling 2MB Transparent Huge Pages (THP) by default for AArch64 Linux. This is being done in the name of better performance -- a healthy 6.25% performance improvement is noted for SPEC with this change...
title: Glibc Now Enabling 2MB THP On AArch64 By Default For Better Performance

author: Michael Larabel
description: The newest feature to land in the cross-platform Qt toolkit is QIORing as an abstraction for Linux's IO_uring interface. This QIORing may also end up supporting Microsoft's Windows IORing implementation as well...
title: Qt Toolkit Lands IO_uring Abstraction

author: Michael Larabel
description: Given the recent release of FreeBSD 15, I started off my testing in looking at how FreeBSD 15.0 improves performance versus FreeBSD 14.3. Now it's onto the next important question: how is FreeBSD 15.0 performing relative to Linux on servers? Here are some benchmarks exploring that topic today.
title: FreeBSD 15.0 vs. Ubuntu Linux For AMD EPYC Server Performance

author: Michael Larabel
description: AMD FSR SDK 2.1 is now available that includes their "FSR Redstone" machine learning based upscaling tech for gaming..
title: AMD FSR SDK 2.1 Released With FSR Redstone - Windows-Only For Now

author: Michael Larabel
description: Turbostat is the Linux command-line utility for reporting CPU frequency / power / C-states and related performance / power management items namely for modern AMD and Intel processors. This CLI utility lives within the Linux kernel source tree and for Linux 6.19 has picked up a few new features...
title: Turbostat Introduces New Cache Statistics, Nova Lake + Wildcat Lake Support

author: Michael Larabel
description: In addition to approving Fedora Cloud switching /boot to a Btrfs subvolume, another change approved this week by the Fedora Engineering and Steering Committee (FESCo) is for shipping the Budgie 10.10 desktop packages in Fedora 44...
title: Budgie 10.10 Desktop Approved For Fedora 44 Packaging, Fedora Budgie Spin All-Wayland

author: Michael Larabel
description: The past several months Intel software engineers have been quite busy with LLM-Scaler as part of Project Battlematrix. LLM-Scaler is a Docker-based solution for AI workloads on Intel graphics hardware to ship an optimized vLLM stack and other AI frameworks. Out today is a new LLM-Scaler-Omni release to help enhance ComfyUI performance on Intel hardware...
title: Updated Intel LLM-Scaler-Omni Improves ComfyUI Performance For Arc Graphics

author: Michael Larabel
description: A performance fix has been submitted to the Linux kernel for dealing with a regression in the Slab memory allocation code...
title: Linux Fixes A Performance Regression In The Slab Code

author: Michael Larabel
description: While the Linux kernel has inclusive terminology guidelines for the past five years to replace phrases like master/slave and blacklist/whitelist, there has surprisingly been a "genocide" function within the kernel that was questioned when it was first submitted for inclusion but now removed in Linux 6.19...
title: Linux 6.19 Gets Rid Of The Kernel's "Genocide" Function
